result.execSummary:
The defendant William A. Kaplan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On Count #2 ,the Court imposes 2 years prison with 18 months Initial Confinement and 6 months Extended Supervision

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

**Per 1/17/18 Order 372 days credit to be applied to the concurrent
sentence of both Counts 2 and Count 3**

02/08/17: Extend Mr. Kaplan's Probation by 1 year ending on 3/31/18, for him to successfully complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming

03/16/17: The Court rescinds its order regarding the extenstion of Mr. Kaplan's Probation 

03/16/17: The Court does extend Mr. Kaplan's probation for one year and his new date of discharge is 3/31/18

miscConds.notes: to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge  plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no precense in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--random drug testing
--all court fees, costs and assessments should be taken out of posted bond and remainder returned to the person who posted. 
 
Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

*** 2/8/17: Court orders JOC be amended to add No Contact with Julie Kaplan or her residence without prior approval from your agent, except for treatment purposes.***

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC
So, Motion is granted. Clerk to Amend JOC
State's Response to Jail Credit
Defendant's Brief in Support of Motion for Conditional Jail Credit Amended Judgment of Conviction and Order for Release
Scheduling

[MK] case called at 9:41am. 
Defendant William A. Kaplan appears via video conferencing from Racine Correctional Institution, in custody.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for the State, along with Probation Agent Jesse Phelps. 
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
ADA Teuber argues that Mr. Kaplan has received the credit he is due, explaining that the nine-month jail served credit only applies to Count #3, not to both Counts #2 & #3. 
The Court discusses with Mr. Kaplan that it appears that the credit was appropriately applied, however the Court would allow Mr. Kaplan the opportunity to brief it.  The Court recommends to Mr. Kaplan that he contact the DOC staff who are the "technician"-type staff who calculate credit-due to defendants.   
The Court indicates that once Mr. Kaplan files a brief, the State has thirty days to file a Response to that Brief. 
If the State does not file a response, then the Court will act on Mr. Kaplan's Brief.  
If the State does file a Response Brief, then Mr. Kaplan has fifteen days thereafter to file a Reply.   The Court indicates to the clerk that when the briefing is completed, the matter should be referred to the Court for the Court to make a written decision. 
recess 9:59am 

NEXT:  Briefing Schedule is in place
Set for Hearing by video 15 minute
Motion hearing on December 14, 2017 at 09:30 am.

[MA]Case called at 2:29pm
Defendant William A. Kaplan in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Jesse Phelps present in courtroom gallery. 
  
The Court discloses, [**under SCR 60.04**] that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that then-DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Kaplan. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Court makes record re: due process
The Court makes inquiries of Agent Phelps the intent of 2/1/17 filings

The Court rescinds its order regarding the extenstion of Mr. Kaplan's Probation 

Arguments given by Atty. Fischer for not extending Mr. Kaplan's probation
The Court makes inquiries of ADA Beck
ADA Beck indicates that the State does support DOC to extend probation

The Court does extend Mr. Kaplan's probation for one year and his new date of discharge is 3/31/18

Case called at 11:05am [mo]
Defendant William A. Kaplan in court with Attorney Richard R. McCue.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance, and notes the victim is present in the gallery.
Mr.Kaplan waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
 
ADA Hall submits Victim Impact Statement

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest" entered on Counts #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court finds that Mr. Kaplan is a repeat Domestic Abuse offender, which make Counts #2 and #3 felonies.
The Victim, Ms. Julie Kaplan, makes a statement. 
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel  

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

On Count #2 ,the Court imposes 2 years prison with 18 months Initial Confinement and 6 months Extended Supervision
On Count #3, the Court imposes 2 years prision with 18 months Initial Confinement and 6 months Extended Supervision; concurrent to Count #2 sentence

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

On both Counts #2 & #3, The Court STAYS this sentence and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--On Count #3 to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on 4/12/15 at       7:00  pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no precense in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--random drug testing
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
--all court fees, costs and assessments should be taken out of posted bond and remainder returned to the person who posted. 

Days credit for time already served:  2  days
recess: 11:42am
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 11:17am[MO]
Defendant William A. Kaplan in court, in custody. ADA Monica Hall  appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Tim Taylor from the Scram Monitoring Program is present in the Courtroom.

The Court reviews right to counsel with Mr. Kaplan. Mr Kaplan indicates he has retained Attorney Richard Mc Cue is this case. However, he does not he feel he needs Attorney Mc Cue with him today. 
Mr. Kaplan intends to proceed today without an Attorney.
ADA Hall motions for the Court to set a $1000 cash bail requirment, and gives argument in support of the motion. 
Mr. Kaplan indicates that he has witnesses that will testify that they were present with Mr. Kaplan during the times of the aledged tampering occured. Now however, Mr. Kaplan indicates he is consenting the Court setting the cash bond. 
ADA Hall gives an offer of proof regarding the scram-bracelet tampering. 
The Court finds probable cause to believe the Defendant has violated bond. 
The Court requires a $1000 cash bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. 
The Court clarifies that the March 31st date remains on the Courts calendar. 
Recess: 11:29am

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called @ 1:17 pm 

Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SPD appears for bond purposes only. The Court was advised by the jail that the defendant is intoxicated. Initial appearance will be scheduled for 01/26/2015 @ 1:15pm.
Court sets bond of $2500 signature bond.
Conditions of bond: 
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion.
-  No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores. 
-  When he is absolutely sober, the defendant may be released by the jail conditioned upon SCRAM.  -  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on .  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
-  No direct or indirect contact with Julie Kaplan.  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the other person on your behalf except an attorney. 
-  No presence at 901 N. High Street, Fort Atkinson.  Except once while in the presence of law enforcement to obtain personal belonging upon reasonable notice. 
-  No possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
-  No possession of any drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
-  Take all prescription medication as prescribed. 
-  Provide new address by the next appearance on this case which is scheduled for Monday 1/26/2015 at 1:15pm in the Branch 2 courtroom, Room 229. 

NEXT: Initial appearance 01/26/2015 @ 1:15pm
